text: Pet 1l nabyte na 3 ŚGB w Tychach 2017. Kolor bursztynowy, piana biała średnio obfita. Aromat karmelowy i prawie nic poza tym. Smak karmel, i słodycz z wytrawnym finiszem. Piwo mogło by być lepsze ale brakuje mu polotu.

Aroma light malty. Hazy, copper, thick creamy beige head. Palate silky with low carbonation. Taste caramel, creamy malty with hint of vanilla and hop not e in finish. Balanced. Tasty. A fine example of amber lager.

(tap 0,5l @ Zastávka (Brno))
Aroma: Sweet, caramel.
Appearance: Clear amber-red color. Medium white head.
Taste: Medium sweet, caramel, light toasty.
Palate: Medium body. Bitter finish.
Overall: Sweet, caramel beer.

on tap at klub malych pivovaru in pilsen. pretty reliable polotmavy - dark amber with a frothy white head; aromaa of wet metal and peanut brittle; plenty of caramel sweetness, tinny and grassy hops, red berries, modest bitterness

On tap, V podloubi, Prague. For a polotmave a bit too much on the sweet side for my liking. Aroma, taste and palate all show butter and caramel. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Draught at Zly Casy Prague, January 2013. Clear amber, white head. Butter and faint grass aroma and a sweet, buttery taste. Light body, hardly any carbonation or aftertaste.

Draught at Zly Casy, Prague. Label said 4.2 percent. Clear amber/copper beer with a quite nice offwhite head. Malty toffee aroma, caramel, grapes, nutty notes, biscuits, some grapes. Malty almond flavor, caramel, grapes, citrus, hay, toffee, some vinous notes.

1.5l PET. A yeasty, caramelly and buttery beer, typical for a Czech brewpub polotmave. Alas, this one boasts some strawberry notes as well. Medium, bodied, light sweet with a dry, bitter finish. Soft mouthfeel, quite fruity flavour. Maybe a tad astringent in the aftertaste. Ok.

PET Láhev 1500 ml. Aroma je příjemné zemité. Pěna je lehce nahnědlé barvy, jemná, středně vysoká a drící. Barva samotného piva je tmaví měděná a lehce kalná. Chuť má příjemný, sladově karamelový střed, lehký banánový okraj, fini je jemně kávově hořký a drící. Vcelku se jedná o příjemné polotmavé pivo se zajímavou chutí, dobře zahání ízeň a má vysokou pitelnost.

Keg on the square at Jiriho Z Podebrad. Pours a deep Brown with a thick White head. Looks a bit like a pint of best with its smooth, creamy head. Nice caramel notes. Its got almost no carbonation which I like. Sometimes Polotmavys actually have a bit in common with cask ale. A full bodied, malty brew which I enjoyed greatly on a sunny Autumn morning.

(Draught at U Slovanske Lipy, Prague, 19 July 2013) Reddish amber colour with frothy, beige head. Malty, fruity nose with toast, orange, apricots and rye bread. Malty taste with notes of toast, caramel, toffee, hints of orange, rye bread and a mild, spicy bitterness in the finish. Medium body, with a slight sweetness. Balanced and tasty. Quite enjoyable.
Tap at Richtar Jakub. Amber colored beer with medium off white head.Aroma of caramel, sweet malt, yeast. Sweet taste with caramel, malt, light hoppy bitterness in finish.
On tap. Pours dark amber color with white head. Aroma of caramel, sweet, hints of yeast. Taste is medium bitter, lightly sweet, caramel.

On tap at Zly Casy. Copper pour with thick white head. Caramel aroma, lots of toasted grain, some fruitiness as well (pear mostly). Taste of caramel, toasted grain, some fruit, light roasty finish. Silky palate, just a tad sweet/heavy.

My Bottom Line:
Mild caramel and toasted bread allusions dominate in this dryish Polotmavé.

Further Personal Perceptions:
-A sheet of foam covers the deep amber shine.
-This one didnt have the malty depth I look for in Polotmavy.
-Hops are very light in here.
-The flavor profile was forgettable.

On tap at Zly Casy.
Color is brown-red with no head at all. Aroma of  malts, caramel,  roast pumpkin. Taste is sweet and quite nice. Medium body and light carbonation almost none. Better then I was expecting.
Bottle from brewery restaurant. Slightly hazy amber colour. Small off-white head. Aroma of caramel, hops, rather dull. Taste is light to medium bitter, none to light sweet. Dry bitter finish.
Bottle from Pivonka. No head but pleasant taste,nice aroma, pretty good beer!

1.5 liter PET from the brewpub, sampled on June 5, 2011Hazy brown color, off-white head. Butterscotch, sweet, malty, roasted taste. Dry, bitter, butterscotch aftertaste. Medium mouthfeel, medium low bitterness. Sweet, malty, fruity, butterscotch, berry scent.
